name: lily
body: I thought I was the only one to ever thoroughly try to understand how there have been now 2 millionaire dollar winners. I couldn't believe I found this article! I completely agree that they did at least plan the first one if not the second too. Regardless its nice enough to see someone win it. Great work!

name: emmanuel
body: good wheel of fortune no spin zipper!!!

name: Justin
body: Great article? Have you considered the odds accounting for the MDW being physically smaller? I would love to see more data I'm wheel fan and love to see more stats on players decisions. Also data on how much money players win relative to the other players since everyone "wins". Last thought: could her winning only 27 games actually prove the game is truly random?

name: bone
body: I googled this because I saw a lady win a million on "loud laughter" and before they revealed the prize I already knew what was up... it was fixed for sure.

name: Ann
body:
Justin: "Have you considered the odds accounting for the MDW being physically smaller?"

He did... there are 24 normal-size slots on the wheel, and the MDW is 1/3rd the size of a normal slot, so 24*3 = 72.

"Odds of player spinning million (A)    1 รท 72 ร [valid spins per game]"

name: Ann
body: What I'm wondering about is why all the mentions of 'ABC' as if they're responsible for production decisions? Wheel is a syndicated show airing on many channels including some ABC channels, but everything I've seen indicates the companies responsible for producing it are Sony and CBS.

name: Mike Gioia
body:
@Ann There's no reason why, I just assumed it was ABC since it airs on ABC in New York! I didn't realize the show was syndicated so much.

Sony does in fact own the rights to the show, and CBS has the US distribution rights. I would say in this case it was Sony then that is the "owner". I should update this to reflect that and add a footnote.

name: JDP
body: How much a player would win if he/she answered the $1M question right on the bonus round but did not have the MDW?

name: Cam
body: The small wheel contains a $100,000 card (amongst the other smaller prize cards) which is replaced with a $1M card if the player has the MDW.

name: Michael
body: One has a better 'chance' and that is what it is of obtaining the correct '6' numbers in the Florida lottery.   275,000,000: 1.  Good Luck to all.  Fun for ALL but in the end it's a [suckers] game thinking that 'you' will be the sole winner.
